# get_default_config { #phasic.get_default_config }

```python
phasic.get_default_config(profile='small')
```

Get a pre-defined configuration profile.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

<code>[**profile**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[str](`str`)]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [\'small\']{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Configuration profile name. Options: - "debug": Single node for debugging (1 node, 4 CPUs) - "small": Small cluster (2 nodes, 8 CPUs each) - "medium": Medium cluster (4 nodes, 16 CPUs each) - "large": Large cluster (8 nodes, 16 CPUs each) - "production": Production setup (8 nodes, 32 CPUs each)

## Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

<code>[]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[ClusterConfig](`phasic.cluster_configs.ClusterConfig`)]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   Pre-configured cluster setup

## Examples {.doc-section .doc-section-examples}

```python
>>> config = get_default_config("medium")
>>> print(config)  # 4 nodes Ã— 16 CPUs = 64 devices
```
